titleStmt.title: Transliteration of The Sanskrit Fragments Or.15003 in the Hoernle Collection in the British Library, London
titleStmt.author: Wille, Klaus

sourceDesc.p: Klaus WILLE, “The Sanskrit Fragments Or.15003 in the Hoernle Collection,” in: Buddhist Manuscripts from Central Asia: The British Library Sanskrit Fragments, Volume I, ed. by Seishi KARASHIMA and Klaus WILLE, Tokyo: The International Research Institute for Advanced Buddhology at Soka University, 2006, 65-153.

encodingDesc.editorialDecl: Input and marked up by IRIAB.

head.p: This catalogue contains transliterations of Sanskrit fragments in the Stein Collection at the British Library.

msItem.note: The text of side A possibly corresponds to sūtra 1307 of the Chinese Saṃyuktāgama (cf. the parallels in SHT VI 1534, SN I 61f. and AN II 47-50).

msItem.q:
a /// + + + [my]. .s. .. ///
b /// + .. tam udīritaṃ [pr]. ///
c /// [t]. ity ucyate siṃh. ///
d /// + .. tra va .. .. .y.ṃ .. ///

msItem.note: Fragment B: remnants of about 3 akṣaras each side

msItem.q:
a /// .. kuśala[m i] + ///
b /// [s](aṃ)ghavyava[hā](r). ///
c /// [ala]j[j]ī bha .. + ///

msItem.note: cf. VAV(UH) 2.48d-58a; to the same folio belong Or.15003/38 and Or.15003/215

4 /// ◯ 6 [s]. .i pradīpe sa .. ///
5 /// .. [bhā] .. tad[v]iśiṣṭa + ///

msItem.note: comment by J.-U. Hartmann: Possibly connected with the so-called Yoga manual, the “Yogalehrbuch” (Schlingloff 1964). The wording preserved in Ax reminds of the many phrases with forms of (pari)pūrṇa and dṛś (cf. index of YL s.vv. paripūrṇa and pṝ), and B3 seems to preserve the yogācāro.

msItem.note: corresponds to Apaṇṇakasutta in the Majjhimanikāya (cf. MN I 409) ~ Apannakasūtra in the Dīrghāgama [cf. SHT VI 1579, Dā (UH), No. 1 (Pell.Skt. bleu 190) and 2 (Hoernle 149/Add. 135)]; identification and notes by J.-U.Hartmann

msItem.title: [Samādhirājasūtra?]
msItem.note: The text of ru-v2 corresponds to the opening verses 19-29 of the SRS (ed. Matsunami); the verses 15-50 are extant only in one Nepalese manuscript. Regarding the gap between recto w and x verse 23 must have been omitted in the text of the fragment in hand which has also a different verse numbering, verse 10 corresponds to verse 24. The text from verso 3 onwards could not be found in the text of the Samādhirājasūtra known so far.
